header.gameNote: SHAMROCK OFFICE SOLUTIONS CLASSIC AT MORAGA CA

article.headline: Rice 67, Western Carolina 62
article.story: MORAGA, Calif. (AP) -- Rice's Morris Almond had 29 of his 36 points in the second half to lift Rice to a 67-62 victory over Western Carolina in the consolation game of the Shamrock Classic at Saint Mary's College on Friday. Almond, the nation's leading scorer, scored eight unanswered points to pull the Owls (6-5) into a 55-55 tie with Western Carolina (5-8), which overcame a 12-point first-half deficit to build a 10-point lead of its own in the second half. With Rice trailing 59-57, Almond sank a 25-foot, 3-pointer with 55 seconds left to put his team ahead. Nick Aldridge, who led Western Carolina with 15 points and nine rebounds, put his team back on top after muscling in a shot with 39 seconds to play. Almond, who hit all 20 free throws he attempted during the tournament, sank three free throws after being fouled on a 3-point attempt. Almond made two more after Aldridge missed a free throw that could have tied the game with 6.8 seconds to play. Almond was fouled on the inbounds pass and sank two more free throws with 6.1 seconds to play to build Rice's lead to three. Antonio Russell, who had 11 for Western Carolina, missed a free throw with 4.6 seconds to play then deliberately missed a second to try, but Rice secured the rebound. Rice's Chris Hagen sank two free throws for his only two points to ice the game. The teams were even statistically, but the Owls made 10 more free throws than Western Carolina.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
